ai.summary: The Coombes Circular Walk is a 7.5 km moderate hike in the UK that makes a scenic loop through farmland, hedgerows and light woodland. The route offers varied terrain and gentle elevation, making it suitable for walkers with some experience seeking a tranquil day out.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of well-defined paths, grassy fields, and quiet lanes, with occasional muddy patches after rain. The surface alternates between compact tracks, stiles, and woodland trails; some sections may be uneven or unevenly surfaced, so sturdy footwear is advised. The route is exposed in parts, so bring sun or wind protection as needed.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather before you go and plan for changing conditions. Wear sturdy boots and carry a waterproof layer. Watch for cattle in field sections and take gates and stiles slowly. Stay on official paths, carry a map or offline navigation, and ensure your phone is charged. Inform someone of your planned return time and be mindful of daylight hours.
recommended_gear: Waterproof jacket and an extra layer
Lightweight rain cover for your pack
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn, when the fields are in bloom and visibility is good; can be walked year-round with appropriate gear and caution in winter.

seo.title: Coombes Circular Walk - 7.5 km Moderate UK Hike
seo.meta_description: Discover the Coombes Circular Walk, a 7.5 km moderate loop in the UK. Enjoy fields, hedgerows and woodland on this scenic 2-3 hour hike. Practical safety and gear tips included.
